dt: {bc}rise, beginning, or derivation from a source
{bc}the point at which something begins or rises or from which it derives
{bc}something that creates, causes, or gives rise to another

dt.t: a spring is the {wi}origin{/wi} of the brook

dt: {bc}the more fixed, central, or larger attachment of a muscle

pt: {sc}origin{/sc} {sc}source{/sc} {sc}inception{/sc} {sc}root{/sc} mean the point at which something begins its course or existence. {sc}origin{/sc} applies to the things or persons from which something is ultimately derived and often to the causes operating before the thing itself comes into being.

pt.t: an investigation into the {it}origin{/it} of baseball

pt: {sc}source{/sc} applies more often to the point where something springs into being.
{sc}inception{/sc} stresses the beginning of something without implying causes.

pt.t: the business has been a success since its {it}inception{/it}

pt: {sc}root{/sc} suggests a first, ultimate, or fundamental source often not easily discerned.

et: Middle English {it}origine{/it}, from Latin {it}origin-, origo{/it}, from {it}oriri{/it} to rise {ma}{mat|orient:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: rise, beginning, or derivation from a source
the point at which something begins or rises or from which it derives; also : something that creates, causes, or gives rise to another

dt: {bc}from a family that did not have high social status or much money
